channel.title: Chrome on Unladen swallow - Olivier Wulveryck
channel.description: Recent content in Chrome on Unladen swallow - Olivier Wulveryck

item.title: Chrome, the eye of the cloud - Computer vision with deep learning and only 2Gb of RAM
item.description: TL;DR: Thank you for passing by. This article is, as usual, geek oriented. However, if you are not a geek, and/or you are in a hurry, you can jump to the conclusion: Any real application? During the month of may, I have had the chance to attend to the Google Next event in London and the dotAI in Paris. In both conferences I learned a lot about machine learning.

item.title: Being a better public speaker with a little help of Speech Recognition, Javascript and Chrome
item.description: Introduction I usually don’t like slidewares. Actually as IT engineer working, by now, exclusively in France, I’m facing the PowerPoint problem: Too many boring slides, too much information per slide, a presenter dedicated to read their content. Therefore, the audience is watching its watch while waiting for a coffee break. I won’t redo the introduction I already did in a previous post but indeed slides can, from time to time, be a value-add to a presentation.
